title: BuildScope POC
description:
**Goal:** Ship a Revit add-in with AI-powered NCC compliance Q&A using RAG over Supabase pgvector and Gemini, ported from the Archie Copilot side panel pattern.

**Architecture:**
- Supabase Postgres + pgvector for NCC embeddings
- Supabase Edge Function for RAG queries (embed → search → Gemini → respond)
- Python ingestion script (one-time NCC PDF processing)
- C#/.NET 8 WPF Revit add-in (dockable side panel)
- Gemini for both embeddings (text-embedding-004) and LLM (2.0 Flash)

**Spec:** .space-agents/exploration/planned/2026-02-20-buildscope-poc/spec.md
**Plan:** .space-agents/exploration/planned/2026-02-20-buildscope-poc/plan.md

title: Set up Supabase project and database schema
description:
**Goal:** Create the Supabase project, enable pgvector, create the ncc_chunks table with metadata columns, and deploy the similarity search function.

**Files:**
- Supabase migrations (applied via MCP or dashboard)

**Steps:**
1. Create Supabase project (or use existing one)
2. Enable pgvector extension
3. Create ncc_chunks table: id, content, embedding(768), volume, part, section, title, applicable_classes (int[]), state_specific, created_at
4. Create HNSW index on embedding for cosine similarity
5. Create GIN index on applicable_classes
6. Create match_ncc_chunks RPC function (query_embedding, filter_volume, filter_class, match_threshold, match_count)
7. Set GEMINI_API_KEY as Supabase secret
8. Verify with test row insert and query

**Tests:**
- [ ] pgvector extension is enabled
- [ ] ncc_chunks table exists with correct columns and types
- [ ] match_ncc_chunks function accepts embedding + filters and returns results
- [ ] Can insert a test row and retrieve it with similarity of 1.0
- [ ] GEMINI_API_KEY secret is set

title: Build Python NCC ingestion script
description:
**Goal:** Create a Python script that parses NCC PDFs into section-based chunks with rich metadata, generates embeddings via Gemini text-embedding-004, and uploads to Supabase pgvector.

**Files:**
- Create: ingestion/ingest.py
- Create: ingestion/requirements.txt
- Create: ingestion/.env.example

**Steps:**
1. Create ingestion/ directory with requirements.txt (pymupdf, supabase, google-genai, python-dotenv, tqdm)
2. Download NCC PDFs and place in ingestion/pdfs/
3. Implement PDF text extraction using PyMuPDF
4. Implement section-based chunking: detect Part/Section headers via regex
5. Split long sections (>2000 chars) at paragraph boundaries
6. Detect applicable building classes per chunk
7. Generate embeddings in batches of 20 with rate limiting
8. Upload to Supabase in batches of 50
9. Add dry-run mode
10. Run ingestion and verify data

**Tests:**
- [ ] Script runs without errors on NCC PDFs
- [ ] Chunks have correct volume based on PDF source
- [ ] Section IDs match NCC format (e.g. "D2D17", "H1V3")
- [ ] Each chunk has a 768-dimension embedding
- [ ] Dry-run mode prints chunks without calling APIs
- [ ] Data appears in Supabase ncc_chunks table
- [ ] match_ncc_chunks returns relevant results for a test query

comments.author: thebrownproject
comments.text:
[PATHFINDER] Codebase exploration complete

## Codebase Context

### PDF Structure (ncc2022-volume-two.pdf)
- 312 pages, ~624K total chars (~2K chars/page avg)
- Rich TOC with 292 entries: 19 L1 (top sections), 65 L2 (parts/specs), 208 L3 (individual clauses)
- All 208 L3 entries have valid section IDs matching pattern `[A-Z]\d+[A-Z]+\d+` (e.g. H1O1, A6G12, S1C2)
- PyMuPDF TOC (`doc.get_toc()`) is the most reliable chunking anchor -- maps every clause to a page number
- Every page has a 3-line header: `{section_name}\nNCC 2022 Volume Two - Building Code of Australia\nPage {N}` and footer `(1 May 2023)` -- must be stripped
- Section IDs appear on their own line with leading whitespace: ` H1D3` followed by ` Site preparation` on next line, then `[2019: 3.1.1, 3.1.2, 3.1.4]` reference line
- Font analysis: section IDs use Inter-SemiBold size 12.0, Part headers use Inter-SemiBold size 14.0, body text uses ArialMT size 10.0, italics use Arial-ItalicMT
- MuPDF throws ~15 "syntax error in content stream" warnings on certain pages but text extraction still works
- 554 unique section ID matches across full text (includes cross-references, not just headers)
- 23 sections span 2+ pages; largest is H1D6 (Framing) at 7 pages -- these need paragraph-boundary splitting
- 35 pages contain Tables/Figures (e.g. Table H1V1a, Figure H1D4a) -- text extraction from tables may be lossy
- Pages 83-84 contain mathematical formulas (structural verification) -- PyMuPDF extracts garbled symbols for these

### PDF Content Sections (Volume 2 scope)
- Section A (p.29-75): Governing requirements -- Parts A1-A7, Specifications 1-3
- Section H (p.76-153): Class 1 and 10 buildings -- Parts H1-H8, Specifications 42,44 (THIS IS THE CORE CONTENT)
- Schedule 1 (p.155-194): Definitions, Abbreviations, Glossary
- Schedules 4-11 (p.216-312): State/Territory appendices (ACT, NSW, NT, QLD, SA, TAS, VIC, WA)

### State-Specific Content
- State appendices are at L2 level in TOC, not L3 -- they contain modifications like "Delete H1D4(1) and insert NSW H1D4(1) as follows:"
- State-prefixed section IDs exist in the text: `NSW H6V1`, `QLD H1P2`, etc. (162 unique state-prefixed IDs found)
- These are inline in the main text too (e.g. `QLD H1D3(3)` annotations appear within main Section H content)
- State schedule pages (216-312) account for ~30% of the PDF but are modifications/overrides, not standalone sections

### Supabase Schema (confirmed deployed)
- `ncc_chunks` table: id(bigint IDENTITY ALWAYS), content(text), embedding(vector), volume(smallint), part(text nullable), section(text nullable), title(text nullable), applicable_classes(int[] default {}), state_specific(bool default false), created_at(timestamptz default now())
- `match_ncc_chunks` RPC: accepts query_embedding(vector), filter_volume(smallint), filter_class(int), match_threshold(float default 0.7), match_count(int default 8). Returns id, content, section, title, part, volume, applicable_classes, similarity. Uses cosine distance `1 - (embedding <=> query_embedding)`.
- RLS enabled: only policy is `Allow anon read access` (SELECT for anon role). NO INSERT policy exists.

### Environment
- `/Users/fraserbrown/Documents/Programming/buildscope/.env` has SUPABASE_URL, SUPABASE_ANON_KEY, GEMINI_API_KEY
- `.env` does NOT have SUPABASE_SERVICE_ROLE_KEY (only the .env.example has the placeholder)
- No `ingestion/` directory exists yet -- needs to be created

## Implementation Guidance

### Chunking Strategy (use TOC, not regex on raw text)
- `doc.get_toc()` returns `[(level, title, page), ...]` -- 208 L3 entries define every clause boundary
- For each L3 entry, extract text from its start page to the next L3 entry start page
- Within that page range, locate the section ID in text to find the exact start position (section IDs appear as ` {ID}\n` with leading space)
- Strip the 3-line page header (`{section_name}\nNCC 2022...\nPage {N}`) and footer `(1 May 2023)` from each page before concatenation
- Strip the `[2019: ...]` or `[New for 2022]` reference lines from chunk content (these are version annotations, not NCC content)
- Part ID can be derived from the TOC hierarchy: track the current L2 entry when iterating

### Regex Patterns for Text Cleanup
- Page header: `r"^.+\nNCC 2022 Volume Two - Building Code of Australia\nPage \d+\n"` (first 3 lines of each page)
- Page footer: `r"\(1 May 2023\)\s*$"` (last line of each page)
- Section ID line: `r"^\s*([A-Z]\d+[A-Z]+\d+)\s*$"` (line containing only the section ID)
- Section title line: follows immediately after section ID line
- Version annotation: `r"^\[(?:2019|New for 2022):.+\]\s*$"` (reference to previous NCC version)
- State annotation inline: `r"^(?:NSW|VIC|QLD|SA|WA|TAS|NT|ACT)\s+[A-Z]\d+[A-Z]+\d+.*$"` (state-specific flags in main text)
- Bullet points appear as separate `\u2022` lines (the bullet char is on a line by itself after the bullet text in PyMuPDF output)

### Section ID Patterns
- Main sections: `[A-Z]\d+[A-Z]+\d+` -- letter(A/H) + part number + type letter(G/O/F/P/V/D) + clause number
  - G = Governing requirement, O = Objective, F = Functional Statement, P = Performance Requirement, V = Verification Method, D = Deemed-to-Satisfy
- Specifications: `S\d+C\d+` -- S + spec number + C + clause number
- State-prefixed: `(NSW|VIC|QLD|SA|WA|TAS|NT|ACT)\s+[A-Z]\d+[A-Z]+\d+`

### Building Class Detection (Volume 2)
- All Volume 2 content applies to classes 1 and 10 by default (per spec)
- The plan says: "Volume 2 sections default to classes [1, 10]"
- State appendix content should set state_specific=true

### Gemini text-embedding-004 API
- Use `google-genai` Python SDK (package: `google-genai`)
- Call: `client.models.embed_content(model="text-embedding-004", contents=[list_of_strings], config=types.EmbedContentConfig(output_dimensionality=768))`
- Accepts a list of strings for batch embedding in a single call
- Batch limit per request: up to 250 texts or 20,000 tokens total per call (Vertex AI docs)
- Free tier rate limits: ~1,500 RPM; plan says batches of 20 with 0.5s delay which is very conservative and safe
- Returns `response.embeddings[i].values` (list of floats, 768 dims when configured)
- Note: newer `gemini-embedding-001` exists but plan specifies `text-embedding-004` -- stick with plan

### Supabase Bulk Insert
- `supabase.table("ncc_chunks").insert([list_of_dicts]).execute()` for bulk insert
- Each dict needs: content, embedding (list of 768 floats), volume, part, section, title, applicable_classes, state_specific
- Do NOT include `id` (it is IDENTITY ALWAYS -- auto-generated, cannot be set)
- Do NOT include `created_at` (has default)
- Plan says batches of 50 rows per insert call

### RLS Blocker
- The table has RLS enabled with ONLY a SELECT policy for anon role
- The anon key in .env CANNOT insert data
- The service role key is NOT in .env (only placeholder in .env.example)
- Options: (a) add service role key to .env, (b) add an INSERT policy for service_role, or (c) the ingestion script needs SUPABASE_SERVICE_ROLE_KEY env var
- The supabase-py client created with the service role key bypasses RLS

## Risks

### BLOCKER: No INSERT access
- RLS only has anon SELECT policy. No service role key in .env. The ingestion script cannot insert data without one of: (a) adding SUPABASE_SERVICE_ROLE_KEY to .env (get from Supabase dashboard > Settings > API), or (b) adding an RLS INSERT policy. Builder should add the service role key to .env and .env.example, and use it for the supabase client in the ingestion script.

### Mathematical Formula Pages (p.83-84)
- H1V1 (Structural reliability) and H1V2 contain formulas that PyMuPDF extracts as garbled Unicode symbols. These chunks will have low-quality text. Acceptable for POC -- flag but do not block.

### Table Extraction Quality
- 35 pages have tables. PyMuPDF text extraction may produce poorly formatted table content. For POC this is acceptable but some chunks will be noisy.

### State Appendix Structure
- State-specific content (p.216-312) is not in L3 TOC entries -- it is at L2 level with different structure (inline modifications). For POC, these can be chunked as larger blocks per state schedule page range, with state_specific=true. Alternatively, skip state appendices entirely for POC and focus on Sections A and H only.

### Long Sections Needing Splitting
- 23 sections span 2+ pages. H1D6 (Framing) is 7 pages (~14K chars). The >2000 char splitting at paragraph boundaries is needed for these. Use double-newline as paragraph boundary.

title: Deploy Supabase Edge Function for RAG queries
description:
**Goal:** Create and deploy a TypeScript/Deno Edge Function that receives a question + project context, runs vector search with metadata filtering, calls Gemini LLM with retrieved chunks, and returns an answer with NCC section references.

**Files:**
- Supabase Edge Function: ncc-query (deployed via MCP)

**API Contract:**
- Request: { question, context: { building_class, state, construction_type }, chat_history? }
- Response: { answer, references: [{ section, title }] }

**Steps:**
1. Implement Edge Function with POST handler and input validation
2. Embed query via Gemini text-embedding-004 REST API
3. pgvector search via supabase.rpc("match_ncc_chunks") with volume + class filtering
4. Build system prompt injecting project context and NCC citation format
5. Call Gemini 2.0 Flash with chunks + system prompt + chat history
6. Extract structured references from answer text
7. Return { answer, references }
8. Deploy with verify_jwt: true
9. Test with curl for different building classes
10. Document API contract for C# service

**Tests:**
- [ ] Edge Function deploys without errors
- [ ] POST with valid body returns { answer, references }
- [ ] POST with missing fields returns 400
- [ ] Answer contains bold NCC section references
- [ ] Class 1 query retrieves only Volume 2 chunks
- [ ] Class 3 query retrieves only Volume 1 chunks
- [ ] Response time under 10 seconds

title: Wire up end-to-end chat flow
description:
**Goal:** Connect all pieces: ChatPanel sends questions with project context to BuildScopeService, renders responses with markdown and references, manages per-project session memory, handles project switching and errors.

**Files:**
- Modify: Views/ChatPanel.xaml.cs, Services/BuildScopeService.cs

**Steps:**
1. Wire send button: add user message, show loading, call BuildScopeService.QueryAsync
2. On response: remove loading, add assistant message with references, auto-scroll
3. Per-project chat memory: Dictionary<string, ObservableCollection<ChatMessage>>, cap 20 messages
4. Project switching: load project chat or show welcome
5. Error handling: missing config, network errors, empty results
6. Send chat history (last 10 messages) with each request
7. Test full loop: create project -> ask question -> get answer -> follow-up

**Tests:**
- [ ] Question sends to Edge Function with correct context
- [ ] Response renders with answer and references
- [ ] 20-message cap with FIFO eviction
- [ ] Project switching loads correct chat
- [ ] Missing config shows helpful error
- [ ] Network errors display gracefully
- [ ] Full loop works end-to-end
